snippet: In February, the Educational Development Corporation said it would remove its titles from Amazon, more evidence of the tumult over who gets to decide how much a book costs.
abstract: Small book publishing company Educational Development Corporation has said it will remove its titles from Amazon, more evidence of the tumult over who gets to decide how much a book costs; publishers, hurt by Amazon's low Internet pricing, are trying to regain control.
lead_paragraph: In February, the Educational Development Corporation said it would remove its titles from Amazon, more evidence of the tumult over who gets to decide how much a book costs.

headline.seo: Amazon’s E-Book Pricing a Constant Thorn for Publishers
